conversation_summary: Silver fish of vape smoke swims from your blazer into Mr Dawson’s prefect badge; the hall folds into a staircase of years—plywood steps cracked open, exhaling pencil-dust. Pastel uniforms run backwards like ribbons as a tape spools your own voice in reverse, stealing memory thread by thread, until you stand on “YEAR 0,” a single plank above dark pine-smoke. A duplicate carbon-you offers the glowing vape; the torch-rod hums forked light, shards orbiting a cracked gauge that reads 00:00.
